rComments: Pretty good prof overall. Just make sure to attend all the lectures and take detailed notes. This will help with term tests. Multiple choice on tests were pretty easy however the short answer is marked very harshly, past tests are a must as he repeats questions. Labs and exam are both free marks.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lecture heavy', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Professor Espie is a very kind professor, make sure to go to every lecture and make your notes as detailed as possible. Multiple choice is very fair, but when writing short answer, make sure to be as descriptive as possible because he is very precise with what he wants for full marks. Office hours are incredibly helpful as well.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Didn't like this profs tests - you had to be extremely specific in SA and MC was always abstract. He makes this course have so much more homework/assessments than it requires. Only reason I gave a 2 and not a 1 was because the final exam was VERY EASY! Don't even bother studying your notes, just do a bunch of past exams b/c that's 85% of the exam.

This class overall was difficult. Attending class is a must as his lecture slides do not go into to much detail as he expects on his tests. Smart biology videos REALLY helped out a lot!!! The textbook is not necessary to get.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Test heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Espie knows the material with ridiculously high detail and expects you to do so. MC on the tests are straight forward, SA are marked ridiculously hard. Make sure to get past tests as he always repeats questions. Textbook is useless, tutorials are useless, tutorial summary sheets and Smart Biology videos are a life saver.

Dr. Espie was an excellent prof. He always conveys the material in the course in an easy to understand matter. His tests are straight forward as long as you pay attention in class, read the textbook and consistently go over your notes well before the day of the test. Looking forward to taking another course with him in the future.

He expects a lot of detail on tests. Don't need textbook. Everything is lecture. Attend, record, type out on the PPTs and study that. Most importantly, he repeats a lot from past tests.  Do all the past tests as well.  He will also test past lecture content on future test ex: transcription when you'd expect translation on the test.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy']

rComments: It's a great learning opportunity, he knows the material inside and out and wants you to have a passion for it as well. Just pay attention in lectures because the information covered is not in your textbooks or google even as he teaches you material that has just recently been discovered. Love what you're studying and you will do well.

Espie is a great prof, he knows his material inside-out and expects the same from his students. If you study hard and go to lectures + tutorials you will do well. There is a lot of material but if you understand + memorize it there will be no surprises on the test. PAST TESTS ARE A MUST! Espie is a creature of habit.

Fair professor, tests were not very difficult, often easy MC. He felt bad for poor SA performance on test 2 and made our 3rd test and exam easier with repeated questions. Know tutorial notes and lecture notes inside out. Clarify things on wikipedia and make sure to UNDERSTAND everything and you will get an A. Late night lecs were annoying.

Overall fair teacher, watch out for short answer on the tests, questions are easy but he requires you to write back every thing you've learned. So make sure you know your stuff in detail. Lectures+ Tutorials+PAST TESTS are a must, text is pretty much useless. Study hard and in detail and it's easy to get 4.0.

Course content overall is pretty intense/difficult so obviously midterms/exam are pretty hard too. There is no way to get through it without studying your butt off. That being said, prof espie is really nice and approachable-although 2 hour late evening lectures are hard to stay awake for. Tutorial documents and lecture notes are a life saver.
really rude, but knows his stuff.

A really nice guy, knows his material inside out but a very monotone. He excepts you to know your material inside out too! Tests were fair, though a repeat of the same questions from past exams, they still required you to know everything. Hence, they guided you as to how to format your answers. Tutorials were useless but Tutorial notes were a must!
Nice prof but kind of monotone, so that makes night lectures killer! material is easy but u have to MEMORIZE everything to get good marks on the tests.

The prof speaks really slowly and that makes every single minute seem like an hour. GOOD LUCK STAYING AWAKE IN CLASS! Slept Through the semester and still managed to get a good mark. Multiple choice is really easy. but the short answers are killers! Detailed tests,MEMORIZE EVERYTHING THE NIGHT BEFORE and DO PAST TESTS and you should be fine.

Espie is a good prof, although his monotone voice had a tendency to put me to sleep.  His tests were fair; if you go to tutorial every week, go to lectures and read the textbook, you should be fine.  Only negative I have is all the material not being in one place; a bit of a hassle to study different material from the text, tutorials and lectures.

Okay guys. I'm going to be serious with you all. This is how to get at least a 70 without going to class. Make notes on his tutorial notes. They are the most helpful things you'll ever do in the class. Don't bother with the questions on the tutorial slides. And know your amino acids. This is to get at least a 70!!!!!
amazing lecturer. go to the tutorials, your gpa will thank you!

Prof Espie is a great prof, he really knows alot about microbiology and is willing to helps his students before starting his lecture or during his office hours. You have to make really great notes in order to get an A in his class. Overall a great prof whos always nice to his students, past tests are a key to get an A.

this course has a lot of value in it if you're interested in bio...the prof was monotonous 90% of the time but once you get past that you'll know that he explains things very well. the tests were cumulative which might seem like a buzzkill but you'll thank him because studying for the exam will be easy! TAs expect highly detailed answers on SA.
Boring Prof who rambles a lot. Multiple Choice Questions are easy, Short Answer Questions are hard (TA's mark them pretty unreasonably). Would recommend taking BIO206 in summer if it's required.
Good lecturer, the material is just hard.

Dr. Espie is an amazing lecturer and he's very kind as he had no problem staying after class to help with concepts or just chatting. The content is pretty difficult but he was able to explain it to make it more understandable. Exam was ridiculously long but tests weren't.

This prof. is extremly rude when u approach him. He doesnt help you solve past tests. He doesnt want to spend too much time in the office with you. he seems to be unfair at times when the tests are marked. I liked bio206 but he made me hate it.. period!

The course is complex but as a biology lover I enjoyed it! Espie uses all his questions from past exams especially the MC questions. the timing of the course needs to be changed to early morning because half the people in the class were asleep by the first half hour (Class was scheduled on Mondays @ 6-8 pm) Made the course BORING!!

Great guy but depending on who your TA is, the content may make sense or not. Online quizzes had so many problems but I think it wasn't his fault, it was Lowrance (however you spell it). Puts in bonus questions in his tests. His exam had sooo many questions, so if you got stumped on one, you had to move on or run out of time.

I was not too fond of him in bio206 but in 370 he is excellent. He is so passionate about microbio that it's so easy to listen to him. I'm sad that he only teaches the first half. His tests are very fair and he never tries to trick you. All the test material is covered in lecture. Great lectures. Don't love the labs.

Very helpful and friendly prof. Knows a huge amount of information on the subject matter. Anja Lowrance, the head course TA, ruined this course for me completely. Key to success here is to study past tests (memorize past tests) and keep up with readings and tutorial material.

This class is extremely boring and the professors voice is monotone. The tests are primarly from his slides and tend to be very detail oriented. The exam however was much easier. Readings are practically useless. Tutorials are very important

He is alright at a prof, Anja Lowrance as the makes online quizes and term tests as well. The 2 aren't very synchronized. The prof will tell you to contact her about marked grades and she will probably just ignore you. His assistant TA, although competent in the subject, is prejudice and dismisses  questions directed at her work.

Unorganized! he posted slides needed for the exam the night before the exam itself! ... and I quote: "I apologize for posting the notes so late". Its OK George, whats the worst that can happen? Class average = 52%.
He is the worst professor I ever had. His midterms and exams are unfair and especially hard. Think twice before taking any course BIO206H5 with him. He is not helpful at all!!! Avoid him!

Made the course fairly enjoyable despite the boring subject matter. Midterms and quizzes were easy marks. The major project requires quite a bit of effort, but overall, I'd definitely recommend the course with him.

Very detailed, knows his stuff. Harsh to students who ask him what material must be studied (he laughed in my face when I asked him that once). You'll notice a lot of midterm material from strictly his notes but watch out - the exam is somewhat dangerous.

Fluent lecturer, adept at explaining difficult concepts. Most of the course material is outside of the textbook and in his handouts. You should try to follow his lecture as much as possible. Key to good marks is to review past tests. Overall, he's a wonderful prof.
found the mid-term quizes and major project quite fair and if u attend his classes read what u need to ... ull be acing :)
He teaches more complex courses, so it's hard to make them interesting.  He does seem helpful, and interested in having the students learn the material.  For what he teaches, he's a good professor.
screwed up my mark...confused and unfair...avoid...hes an idiot
Totally killed my interests in Biology. Unfair mid-terms plus pointless tutorials (though I liked my TA). Though the final was alright...guess he was trying to save himself.
Unorganized, unclear, unfair.
great prof
